snippet: A simple procedure demonstrated on some Android smartphones allows anyone to gain access to funds stored in Google Wallet, Google's mobile payment system that acts as a substitute for traditional credit cards. No hacking is required, and it can take...
abstract: A simple procedure demonstrated on some Android smartphones allows anyone to gain access to funds stored in Google Wallet, Google's mobile payment system that acts as a substitute for traditional credit cards. No hacking is required, and it can take a thief just minutes to start spending your cash.
lead_paragraph: 4:06 p.m. | Updated Adding information at end about Google's "bug bounty" program.

headline.main: Vulnerability in Google Wallet Leaves Funds Wide Open
